metadata.title: CVE-2018-7738 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: In util-linux before 2.32-rc1, bash-completion/umount allows local users togain privileges by embedding shell commands in a mountpoint name, which ismishandled during a umount command (within Bash) by a different user, asdemonstrated by logging in as root and entering umount followed by a tabcharacter for autocompletion.

criterions.comment: util-linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
util-linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
bash-completion: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
